title: Homework Help at the Kitchen Table
caption: A mother guides her son as he writes in a workbook during a calm study session at home.

image.alt: A mother in a patterned headscarf smiles while helping a young boy write in a workbook at a desk.

fullDescription.en: A mother sits beside her young son at a desk and helps him with homework. She points at the workbook while the boy writes with a pencil. The room feels cozy and organized, with a bookshelf behind them and a corkboard covered in notes and papers. A cup of colored pencils and other stationery on the table suggests a regular study routine and a supportive learning environment.

intermediateEnglish.en: A mother is sitting next to her son at a study desk and helping him with his homework. The boy is writing carefully in a workbook while the mother points to the correct line. They both smile, which shows the mood is calm and supportive. In the background, there is a bookshelf and a board with many notes, suggesting that this home is used for learning.

advancedEnglish.en: In a quiet home setting, a mother supports her son during a homework session. The child writes in a workbook while she points to the page and explains what to do next. Their relaxed smiles suggest a warm parent-child relationship and a positive attitude toward learning. The bookshelf, the corkboard full of reminders, and the cup of colored pencils show that this family values an organized study routine. After finishing this page, the boy will probably continue the assignment, and the mother may check his answers and correct small mistakes.

grammar.title: Present Continuous (حال استمراری) برای کارِ در حال انجام
grammar.rule: برای توصیف کاری که **الان** در تصویر در حال انجام است از **am/is/are + V-ing** استفاده کن.

grammar.title: There is / There are (وجود داشتن) برای اشیا و جزئیات صحنه

grammar.title: Modals for inference (might / probably) برای نتیجه‌گیری
grammar.rule: برای حدسِ منطقی بر اساس عکس از **might / may / probably** استفاده کن.

sceneNotes: Keep your first sentence simple: who + where + main action.
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.

lessonOverview.en: This lesson builds everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.

exercises.name: 30-second photo description
exercises.prompt: Describe the photo in 4–5 simple sentences: who they are, what they are doing, and how they feel.
steps: Sentence 1: Where are they? (place + weather/light)
Sentence 2: Who are they and what are they doing?
Sentence 3: How do they feel? Why?
checklist: Use one connector: also / because / so.

exercises.name: 45-second structured speaking
exercises.prompt: Describe the setting and relationship. Mention at least 3 objects on the table and explain what the mother is helping with.
steps: Overview: one sentence about the scene.
Details: 2–3 details (foreground/background).
Inference: make 1 reasonable guess.
Wrap-up: summarize the mood.
tips: Use present continuous for what you see.

exercises.name: 6-minute paragraph (TOEFL style)
exercises.prompt: Write a short paragraph (80–110 words) describing the scene and the mood. Use present continuous and at least 5 vocab words.

model.en: The photo shows mountain valley view: two hikers taking in the scenery with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. In the background, the landscape looks wide and dramatic, which makes the moment feel special. I have had a similar experience on a weekend trip, and it reminded me how refreshing nature can be. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال doing homework هستند.
در home study area / living room workbook/notebook و pencil دیده می‌شود.
فضا warm به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself in home study area / living room. A mother guides her son as he writes in a workbook during a calm study session at home. At first, I noticed workbook/notebook, pencil, colored pencils and the way people were doing homework. Then I looked closer: their clothing (patterned headscarf, casual long-sleeve top) and their expressions made the scene feel warm, focused, supportive. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل home study area / living room بودم. A mother guides her son as he writes in a workbook during a calm study session at home. اول workbook/notebook، pencil و colored pencils را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور doing homework. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (patterned headscarf و casual long-sleeve top) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا warm، focused و supportive به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, they did homework.
Then, they checked workbook/notebook and continued.
Finally, they felt warm about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، They did homework.
بعد، They workbook/notebook را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه warm بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as workbook/notebook, pencil, colored pencils, pencil cup are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like pointing to the workbook can signal feelings such as warm, focused, supportive. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل workbook/notebook، pencil، colored pencils و pencil cup فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل pointing to the workbook چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل warm، focused و supportive را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: They have already handled similar situations before.
They have learned to stay warm in home study area / living room.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: They قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
They یاد گرفته است در home study area / living room warm بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment in home study area / living room, one small change could create a big problem. If workbook/notebook, pencil had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در home study area / living room دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر workbook/notebook و pencil نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If they had checked workbook/notebook earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay warm.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر They زودتر workbook/notebook را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید warm بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
